channel.title: Gaming desktop
channel.description:
What do you guys think, is the price reasonable? I've bought mostly macs so far. I sold my HP desktop, and want to get something cool. http://www.amazon.com/dp/B004L2LAKM/ref=pe_124310_20146560_pe_epc_t1 Product Features
With the improved Windows 7, you get one place to enjoy your photos and music. 8GB DDR3 Memory delivers insane system speed to hanle serious ultra-fast frame rate during game play. ATI Radeon HD6950 2GB dedicated For over 10 Years, iBUYPOWER has provided countless numbers of configurable Gaming Desktops and Notebooks equipped with the latest technology Processor: AMD Phenom II x6 1090 (3.2GHz) Graphics: ATI Radeon HD6960 2GB (HDMI)
Processor, Memory, and Motherboard
Processor: 3.2 hertz Phenom II X6 RAM: 8 GB Memory Slots: 2
Hard Drive
Size: 1000 GB Manufacturer: SATA III Speed: 7200 rpm
Graphics and Display
Graphics RAM: 2000 MB
Ports and Connectivity
USB Ports: 6
Cases and Expandability
Size (LWH): 24.5 inches, 8.7 inches, 21.3 inches Weight: 46 pounds
Warranty and Support
Amazon.com Returns Policies: You may return any new computer purchased from Amazon.com that is "dead on arrival," arrives in damaged condition, or is still in unopened boxes, for a full refund within 30 days of purchase. Amazon.com reserves the right to test "dead on arrival" returns and impose a customer fee equal to 15 percent of the product sales price if the customer misrepresents the condition of the product. Any returned computer that is damaged through customer misuse, is missing parts, or is in unsellable condition due to customer tampering will result in the customer being charged a higher restocking fee based on the condition of the product. Amazon.com will not accept returns of any desktop or notebook computer more than 30 days after you receive the shipment. New, used, and refurbished products purchased from Marketplace vendors are subject to the returns policy of the individual vendor.

item.title: Gaming desktop
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

risinglight:

I think its overpriced…Why don’t you do what im doing and select each of the parts and build your own pc it’s much funner than just buying one ;D.

Just a heads up, I wouldn’t trust someone who uses the word “funner” to give you good information on computers.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming desktop
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

IlikeArrays:

Wait 2-3 more years and pay $500? or spend the same amount of cash for next top thing in…If you enjoy your pc now … just wait

That is exactly why I stopped looking at any laptops once I spent nearly $1500 on myn. Probably something better already out. Although I plan on maxing out the RAM and buying 2 TB HDD’s for it lol.

@Topic - Your best bet is to build one like CJ said. You can get the best motherboard, CPU, Graphics card, etc. As things come out that are better, you should be able to just buy the new piece and keep on the top.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming desktop
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“risinglight, post:8, topic:398683”]I think its overpriced…Why don’t you do what im doing and select each of the parts and build your own pc it’s much funner than just buying one ;D.[/quote]I’m already working on a Mac mini, and I get a bit stressed out as it is trying to find the right parts and navigating through the computer when swapping parts.

Yo CJ i dound one with an intel i5 Processor:

amazon.com

Amazon.com: iBUYPOWER Gamer Supreme Intel A945SLCK Liquid Cooling Gaming Desktop Computer (White) (Discontinued by Manufacturer): Computers & Accessories

Experience a new dimension of interactive gaming, media organization, and content creation with iBUYPOWR Gamer Supreme A945SLCK. Equipped with a powerful Intel i5 2500K proccessor clocked at 3.3 GHz, ...


Product Features

With the improved Windows 7, you get one place to enjoy your photos and music. It's all here.
8GB DDR3 Memory delivers insane system speed to hanle serious ultra-fast frame rate during game play.
NVIDIA GTX570 1280MB dedicated
For over 10 Years, iBUYPOWER has provided countless numbers of configurable Gaming Desktops and Notebooks equipped with the latest technology
Processor: Intel i5 2500K (3.3GHz) Graphics: NVIDIA GTX570 1280MB (HDMI) Hard Disk Drive: 1TB Serial ATA-III Memory: 8GB DDR3-1333

Processor: 3.3 hertz Intel Core i5
RAM: 8 GB
Memory Slots: 2

Hard Drive

Manufacturer: SATA III
Speed: 7200 rpm

Graphics and Display

Graphics RAM: 1280 MB

Ports and Connectivity

USB Ports: 6

Cases and Expandability

Size (LWH): 24.5 inches, 8.7 inches, 21.3 inches
Weight: 48 pounds

Holy shit i want this:

amazon.com

CyberpowerPC Gamer Xtreme 5223LQ, Intel Core i7 980X Extreme CPU, Intel X58 Chipset Motherboard, 12GB (6 x 2GB) DDR3 1333 Triple Channel Memory, 2 TB (1 x 2 TB) SATA III 6.0 Gbps 7200 RPM Hard Drive, ...


Also here’s one with an i7 and only costs 1k

item.title: Gaming desktop
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:6, topic:398683”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=495820.msg3624864#msg3624864 date=1307750389]
Damn that’s a lot for a computer. I honestly don’t think it’s worth that much, and you could get like 3 cheaper laptops for that price. Doesn’t seem worth it in my opinion.
[/quote]
1.3K isn’t that much when talking about computers, 3 years ago I bought a desktop with 4gb ram and 600gb HD and it was about 1K and I got 500$ off. So this is actually a pretty good deal.[/quote]

I really don’t have a very good computer, but I need to upgrade. Probably going to sell my rsgp and then go buy a new one, maybe a macbook.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming desktop
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

marcbob:

Damn that’s a lot for a computer. I honestly don’t think it’s worth that much, and you could get like 3 cheaper laptops for that price. Doesn’t seem worth it in my opinion.

1.3K isn’t that much when talking about computers, 3 years ago I bought a desktop with 4gb ram and 600gb HD and it was about 1K and I got 500$ off. So this is actually a pretty good deal.

item.title: Gaming desktop
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:4, topic:398683”]Ew AMD.
I’d go for a more well known brand (unless it’s just me that’s never heard of that before?), or even better, build it yourself. :D[/quote]I would love to build it myself but I’m really busy with my old mac mini. So while I’m doing my mini’s motherboard I want a nice quick setup (preferably pre-built) for PC games.

[quote=“marcbob, post:3, topic:398683”]Damn that’s a lot for a computer. I honestly don’t think it’s worth that much, and you could get like 3 cheaper laptops for that price. Doesn’t seem worth it in my opinion.[/quote]The water cooling system is a huge plus for me. I can overclock like a dick.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I’d go for a more well known brand (unless it’s just me that’s never heard of that before?), or even better, build it yourself.
